author: RUSANMA
post_text: April 6, 2020 at 3:57 PM#1hi, I want to delete from my "sequence pool" the sequences that do not have content.-Is there any macro to execute this option?-Can the number of sequences be ordered to start at number 1? thanks

posts.author: RUSANMA
posts.post_text: April 6, 2020 at 3:57 PM#1hi, I want to delete from my "sequence pool" the sequences that do not have content.-Is there any macro to execute this option?-Can the number of sequences be ordered to start at number 1? thanks

posts.author: F Dijkers
posts.post_text: April 7, 2020 at 11:15 AM#2Hi,A workaround I use to achieve this is to delete them if it's not assigned to an executor. Macro would look like this:CodeDelete Sequence Thru - Sequence Thru If Executor ThruI'm not sure what you mean by order them at number 1? The pool items are always in order?Kind regards,Floris DijkersLighting Director & Designerflorisdijkers.comlighting@florisdijkers.com

posts.author: RUSANMA
posts.post_text: April 8, 2020 at 11:33 AM#3Hi, when I delete the sequences in the sequence pool they remain with the number they are, I want them to be renumbered and start at 1, so that the sequence pool is ordered. thanks

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: April 8, 2020 at 1:21 PM#4you could remove the gaps, by moving all existing sequence to id 1 and upwards:CodeMove Sequence * At 1

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: April 14, 2020 at 2:45 AM#5Hi DijkersI tried your syntax but it didn't work : Error Delete forbiddenDoes it work for you ?Thx

posts.author: F Dijkers
posts.post_text: April 14, 2020 at 3:34 PM#6Hi Benoît,Excuse me, I typed a little to fast. I found some workaround, but you're right, as I described it it wouldn't work. I use this little trick, I wrote it down already before in some document:Macro line 1:CodeOff Sequence ThruMacro line 2:CodeGo Exec ThruMacro line 3:CodeDelete Sequence Thru - IfActive Sequence ThruHopefully this helps you!Kind regards,Floris DijkersLighting Director & Designerflorisdijkers.comlighting@florisdijkers.com

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: April 14, 2020 at 9:15 PM#7HiThis doesn't work for me, as i expected.Ifactive sequence thru means nothing.Ifactive is to select fixtures.
